```{r}

#define the coefficient of the quadratic equation
c.a=1
c.b=3
c.c=2
coefficients <- c(c.a, c.b, c.c)

#define the function to solve the problem ("found on stackoverflow" )
quad <- function(a, b, c)
 {
     a <- as.complex(a)
     answer <- c((-b + sqrt(b^2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a),
                 (-b - sqrt(b^2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a))
     if(all(Im(answer) == 0)) answer <- Re(answer)
     if(answer[1] == answer[2]) return(answer[1])
     answer
 }

#show the result
quad(1,3,2)

#I want to plot the quadratic function with the coefficient defined showing the intercept of x
# Define the quadratic function
quadratic_function <- function(x) {
  return(x^2 *c.a + c.b*x + c.c)
}

#plot the curve showing the roots
curve(quadratic_function, from = -5, to = 5, col = "blue",xlab = "x", ylab = "f(x)", main = "Quadratic Function", lwd = 2)
 abline(0,0)
```
